page.title: 02Sealand,why that name.
page.content: As the name suggests the land around our area was many years ago covered by the sea,so sea-land this being the case we find today that the soil in this area is very very sandy.Part of our area is in England and part in Wales.Most of the land today is grassland and it is used for farming. Only a few farms have crops.With the near closure of the Shotton Steel Works some 7 years ago when some 9,000 people were made redundant,many small industries have come into the area,an industrial estate has been built here, here at Sealand.Some of the buildings are quite large,but only employ a few people.So today we find that many are unemployed.The land being dug up to form this new industrial area is a sandy colour and is very good for drainage.
